page.title: 02RELIGION IN WHALEY BRIDGE
page.content: There are two churches in the parish of Whaley Bridge.The oldest is in Taxal,the church of St.James.The church was first built in the 14th century but was rebuilt in 1880.The tower is original one. The first rector was called William Downes he was there in 1287 .The windows are stained glass cathedral windows with a shell in each,the shell sign of St. James. The vestry was enlarged in 1927. The tower has 3 floors. The top floor houses the 6 bells,the middle is empty.The bottom floor is where bell ringing takes place,there are also a few memorial stones. Bell-ringing practice is on Thursday night.There are normally about eight people in practice,including me. The tower captain is called Herbert Heaton.
